report_title: Industry Research: Graphic Designers in the US
executive_summary: The graphic design industry has benefited from favorable economic conditions, boosting consumer spending and business advertising investments. However, inflation, volatility and COVID-19 impacts have slowed revenue growth. Over the past 5 years, industry revenue grew at an estimated 2.8% CAGR to $16.6 billion in 2023. Economic growth encouraged new businesses to invest in graphic design for branding and advertising. Incumbent businesses also increased ad budgets to compete. COVID-19 impacted demand in 2020 but accelerated digital advertising adoption. Profit grew with rising demand and technological productivity gains. Over the next 5 years, revenue is projected to grow at a 2.0% CAGR to $18.3 billion, driven by increased ad spending and economic recovery.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Total advertising expenditure closely follows economy
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Businesses spend more on advertising when profits rise. Advertising is often reduced when profits are restricted. Ad spending fell amid COVID-19 business closures.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Spending on digital advertising is increasing
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Traditional media ad spend has decreased as the internet disrupted the media landscape. The internet provides cost-effective targeted advertising with measurable results. Digital media like motion/interactive design accounts for expanding revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Action movies require skilled graphic designers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Movie/video producers employ graphic designers for visual effects, typography and posters. Rising demand from this sector translates to higher service demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Decline of print media challenges designers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Print advertising expenditure has fallen, challenging graphic designers to update skills across alternative media.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Improved design software will lower entry barriers. 3D printing design is emerging. Viral marketing using images/videos will grow. Internet ad spend growth will drive total ad spend. Digitization will reduce costs, increasing profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Skilled labor shortage will increase costs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for skilled designers at ad agencies has increased, especially for online/interactive design talent, raising wages.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Foreign competitors pose the greatest threat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Foreign competition will increase as cloud computing and internet communications improve and lower international work costs.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry plan, design and manage the production of visual communication to convey messages and clarify complex information or visual project identities. Services include creating printed materials, displays, packaging and corporate branding.

negative_impact_factors: Low to increasing barriers to entry

key_trends: Spending on digital advertising is increasing
Digital media like motion/interactive design accounts for expanding revenue share

Manufacturers contract graphic designers or design agencies to produce promotional materials, websites or for aspects of product development, including the design of the packaging.
Print publications transitioning to digital business models have demanded graphic design services to help rebrand and adapt content to online channels.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Regional and Local Customers Demand Service From Smaller Design Companies and Freelancers
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment includes the design of posters, logos and packaging, as well as advertisements for placement in print media.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Majority of Activities are Shifting to Online Platforms
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The segment includes website design and other creative services related to developing and managing customers' online presence.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Rapid Proliferation of Mobile Internet-Accessible Devices Reduces Print Media Consumption
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Services related to printed media design include printing services, illustration and publication design.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Graphic Designers Offer a Variety of Other Services
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Other services include photo editing, product design and other graphic design work not classified elsewhere.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region houses many manufacturers that use graphic design services for rebranding and packaging activities.
Central Florida boasts more theme parks than any other area in the world, needing the services of graphic designers to help them develop images and designs that will enhance a visitor's experience.
Start-up businesses in Silicon Valley will require the services of graphic designers to help them develop a corporate logo, website and other corporate materials.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a high population density. The region has a high concentration of businesses and advertising agencies, increasing demand for graphic design services.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Prevents unauthorized copying, allowing designers to negotiate fees.
Advised distancing and sanitation measures within facilities in 2020.

concentration_points.concentration_description: THE INDUSTRY EXHIBITS A LOW LEVEL OF MARKET SHARE CONCENTRATION
Due to the distribution of revenue among thousands of freelance designers and multiservice design agencies, no graphic design agencies account for more than 5.0% of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases expected to account for 10.7% of revenue in 2023
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: With the increasing amount of work performed digitally, purchases of materials make up a smaller proportion of the average company's expenses.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages estimated at 30.7% of revenue in 2023
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry continues to rely on the skill and creativity of trained artists, despite improvements in software cutting labor requirements.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit estimated at 13.5% of revenue in 2023
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Freelance competition on price and larger agencies' complementary services impact profitability.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Wages are the industry's highest cost
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is labor-intensive, but freelancers have driven wages down.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patents and patent concentration
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This creates a low threat environment for disruptive new technologies.
There are limited new entry points beyond those already served by incumbents.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Graphic designers are impacted by changes in corporate profit and advertising budgets.
Events like the Olympics, World Cup, elections generate more advertising and design work.

volatility_points.volatility_title: New product launches and mergers boost demand
volatility_points.volatility_description: Company activities like new products or mergers increase need for design services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Regional demand for smaller design firms
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Local customers demand service from smaller companies and freelancers for print media design.
Website design and online presence management are a growing segment despite competition from templates.
Print publishers are shifting to online, reducing demand for print design services.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Revenue is heavily dependent on the health of corporate profit, as businesses are more likely to spend money on non-mandatory industry services during times of increasing corporate profit.

FAQs.question: Does your company face significant competition from substitute goods or services?
FAQs.answer: The industry's main competition is businesses that source graphic design internally.

FAQs.question: Previously, graphic design was a costly process, but in the past decade, technology has become more accessible, affordable and user-friendly. How has your enterprise minimized costs?
FAQs.answer: Software and reliance on freelancers can both reduce wage costs in this industry.

FAQs.question: What is your company's most significant operational expense?
FAQs.answer: Labor is by a wide margin the largest cost for graphic design firms.

FAQs.question: The ability to adopt innovative styles and technologies can also represent a strong competitive advantage. Has investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Designers must stay current on new software in order to work in the preferred formats of all clients.

FAQs.question: How has your company ensured that it safeguards propriety information/processes?
FAQs.answer: Graphic designers rely on copyright law, violations of which must generally be enforced civilly by holders of copyrights.

FAQs.question: Has the regulatory environment experienced significant change, or has it remained relatively stable?
FAQs.answer: The Affordable Care Act raised employment costs for some of the larger firms in the industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company benefit (either directly or indirectly) from any government legislation?
FAQs.answer: In general the industry does not face much regulation.

FAQs.question: Does your company struggle to finance its ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: The inconsistency of design contracts can pose a cash flow problem for some businesses.

FAQs.question: Capital expenditure is primarily focused on the purchase of computers and software, among other technology that assists operators with designing concepts. How frequently does your company purchase new capital equipment?
FAQs.answer: The industry has low capital costs, and the emergence of software as a service has even reduced upfront costs for the purchase of updates.

FAQs.question: Do you currently offer competitive pricing on your products? How can you increase the competitiveness of your pitches?
FAQs.answer: Many contracts in the industry are won on tender, so the ability to put together a professional and comprehensive sales pitch while offering a competitive price is important.

FAQs.question: How do you accommodate changing customer needs? How much do you invest in researching rising trends?
FAQs.answer: A wide stylistic range and the ability to customize work on request will attract a greater number of clients with diverse aesthetic and practical needs.

FAQs.question: Do you currently have a diverse range of clients? How can you expand your customer base?
FAQs.answer: Having a range of clients in different economic sectors will minimize revenue volatility.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue comes from movie and video producers? How do you compensate for the seasonality of demand from movie and video production?
FAQs.answer: Movie and video producers demand graphic design services in their production process.

FAQs.question: How will you take advantage of an increase in corporate profit? Do you have successes you can point to in the corporate sector?
FAQs.answer: With an increase in corporate profit, companies tend to spend more on marketing and advertising. This drives greater demand for graphic design services in the corporate sector.

FAQs.question: How will you respond to an increase in demand for graphic design services? What investments might you need to make?
FAQs.answer: Much of the work that graphic designers do is for corporate advertisements; therefore, as expenditure on advertising increases, so does demand for graphic design services.
